input_text:
Job Title: Associate Professor (Open Rank) - Oral Immunology and Infectious Diseases

Location: Louisville, KY

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Education, Training

Description:
Department:

Oral Immun & Infect Dis

Location:

Health Sciences Center

Time Type:

Full time

Worker Type:

Regular

Job Req ID:

R104384

Position Description:

The Department of Oral Immunology and Infectious Diseases (http://louisville.edu/dentistry/departments/oralhealth), housed in the School of Dentistry at the University of Louisville, invites applications for a full-time Assistant/Associate Professor faculty position. This position may be tenure track or tenure depending on qualifications and experience. Academic rank and salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience.

The department comprises well-funded investigators focused on microbial pathogenicity, innate immunity and inflammation, and we are looking for applicants interested in fundamental disease mechanisms and host responses in the oral cavity. Applicants should possess a Ph.D. or equivalent degree and have a strong independent, funded, research program.

Qualified applicants should submit a letter of interest, curriculum vitae, and two professional reference letters with their application.

The School of Dentistry is committed to creating equitable and inclusive campus environments that accelerate the success of the full range of our students and employees. We believe that employees who feel valued and respected will create policies, programs, practices, research agendas, and services to effectively meet the needs and exceed the expectations of the increasingly diverse student populations we admit and hope to serve.

Equal Employment Opportunity

The University of Louisville is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer, and is committed to providing employment opportunities to all qualified applicants without regard to race, sex, age, color, national origin, ethnicity, creed, religion, disability, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity and expression, marital status, pregnancy, or veteran status. If you are unable to use our online application process due to an impairment or disability, please contact the Employment team at employment@louisville.edu or 502.852.6258.

Assistance and Accommodations

Computers are available for application submission at the Human Resources Department located at 215 Central Avenue, Ste 205 - Louisville, Kentucky 40208.

If you require assistance or accommodation with our online application process, please contact us by email at employment@louisville.edu or by phone 502-852-6258.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
